briefdescription.para: returns bone index for a name (-1 if pBoneName doesn't exist)

memberdef.argsstring: (Object arrow, int componentIndex, vector closeBonePosWS, vector closeBoneRotWS)
memberdef.name: AddArrow

simplesect.para: NON-MANAGED, will be managed by C++ once it is sent to the CommandHandler through DayZAnimal.StartCommand_Script

So ideally, it is best to set up the DayZAnimalCommandScript, not create any instances and start it through DayZAnimal.StartCommand_ScriptInst In case an instance needs to be created, it needs manual deletion if not sent to the CommandHandler But deleting it while it is in the CommandHandler will cause crashes constructor must have 1st parameter to be DayZAnimal this terminates command script and shows CommandHandler( ... pCurrentCommandFinished == true );

detaileddescription.para: override this ! final adjustment of physics state (after physics was applied) returns true if command continues running / false if command should end (or you can use SetFlagFinished(true))
